TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SyndicationItem extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a feed item, for example an RSS or an Atom .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When serialized to Atom 1.0, a SyndicationItem instance is written to an `<entry>` element. The following table shows how each property defined for SyndicationItem is serialized for Atom 1.0.
|SyndicationItem property|Serialized form| |------------------------------|---------------------| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.AttributeExtensions%2A>|Attribute in the `<entry>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Authors%2A>|An `<author>` element for each author in the collection.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Categories%2A>|A`<category>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Content%2A>|A`<content>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Contributors%2A>|A`<contributor>` element for each contributor in the collection.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Copyright%2A>|A`<rights>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.ElementExtensions%2A>|Element in the `<entry>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Id%2A>|An `<id>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.LastUpdatedTime%2A>|An `<updated>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Links%2A>|A `<link>` element for each link in the collection.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.PublishDate%2A>|A `<published>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.SourceFeed%2A>|A `<source>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Summary%2A>|A `<summary>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Title%2A>|A `<title>` element.|
When serialized to RSS 2.0, a SyndicationItem instance is written to an `<item>` element. The following table shows how each property defined for SyndicationItem is serialized for RSS 2.0.
|SyndicationItem property|Serialized form| |------------------------------|---------------------| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.AttributeExtensions%2A>|Attribute in the `<item>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Authors%2A>|A `<managingEditor>` if only one <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> is in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Authors%2A> collection; otherwise, the `<a10:author>` element for each author in the collection.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Categories%2A>|A `<category>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Content%2A>|An `<a10:content>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Contributors%2A>|An `<a10:contributor>` element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Contributors%2A> collection.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Copyright%2A>|A `<copyright>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.ElementExtensions%2A>|Element in the `<item>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Id%2A>|An `<a10:id>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.LastUpdatedTime%2A>|An `<a10:updated>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Links%2A>|A `<link>` element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink> in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Links%2A> collection.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.PublishDate%2A>|A `<pubDate>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.SourceFeed%2A>|A `<source>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Summary%2A>|A `<description>` element.| |<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Title%2A>|A `<title>` element.|

## Examples The following code shows how to add a permalink to a syndication item.
[!code-cs[SyndicationItem#36](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.servicemodel.sy_16_1.cs)] [!code-vb[SyndicationItem#36](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.servicemodel.sy_16_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets the attribute extensions for the syndication item.
Docs.value: A dictionary that contains a collection of attribute extensions.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Syndication object model allows you to add custom attributes to a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance. When serialized for Atom 1.0, the custom attribute is written to an `<entry>` element. When serialized for RSS 2.0, the custom attribute is written to an `<item>` element. For a complete example that shows how to add an attribute extension, see the [Loosely-Typed Extensions](../Topic/Loosely-Typed%20Extensions%20Sample.md) sample.
## Examples The following code shows how to add an attribute extension to a syndication feed.
[!code-cs[LooselyTypedExtensions#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.sy_33_1.cs)] [!code-vb[LooselyTypedExtensions#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.sy_33_1.vb)]
The following XML code shows an Atom 1.0 serialization of a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance with a custom attribute called `itemAttrib`.
[!code-xml[SyndicationItem#4](~/add/codesnippet/xml/p-system.servicemodel.sy_33_2.xml)]
The following code shows the same <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance serialized as RSS 2.0.
[!code-xml[SyndicationItem#5](~/add/codesnippet/xml/p-system.servicemodel.sy_33_3.xml)]

Docs.summary: Gets the authors of the syndication item.
Docs.value: A collection of objects that represent the authors of the syndication item.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When serializing to Atom 1.0, an `<author>` element is written for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the Authors collection.
When serializing to RSS 2.0. a `<managingEditor>` element is written if the Authors collection has only one <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson>, otherwise a `<a10:author>` element is written for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the Authors collection.
## Examples The following code shows how to add an author to the Authors collection of a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem>.
[!code-cs[SyndicationItem#22](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.sy_32_1.cs)] [!code-vb[SyndicationItem#22](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.sy_32_1.vb)]
The following XML shows how the preceding <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> is serialized to Atom 1.0.
[!code-xml[SyndicationItem#6](~/add/codesnippet/xml/p-system.servicemodel.sy_32_2.xml)]
The following XML shows how the preceding <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> is serialized to RSS 2.0.
[!code-xml[SyndicationItem#7](~/add/codesnippet/xml/p-system.servicemodel.sy_32_3.xml)]

Docs.value: A collection of objects that represent the categories of the syndication item.

remarks.format:

## Examples The following code shows how to add a category to the Categories collection of a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem>.
[!code-cs[SyndicationItem#23](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.sy_8_1.cs)] [!code-vb[SyndicationItem#23](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.sy_8_1.vb)]

[!code-xml[SyndicationItem#9](~/add/codesnippet/xml/p-system.servicemodel.sy_8_3.xml)]

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code shows how to clone an instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> class.
[!code-cs[SyndicationItem#41](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.servicemodel.sy_8_1.cs)] [!code-vb[SyndicationItem#41](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.servicemodel.sy_8_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets and sets the content of the syndication item.
Docs.value: A instance that contains the content of the syndication item.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationContent> is a base class for all syndication content types. The [!INCLUDE[netfx35_short](~/add/includes/netfx35-short-md.md)] defines the following syndication content types:
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.TextSyndicationContent>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.UrlSyndicationContent>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.XmlSyndicationContent>
You can assign this property to any of these content types (or possibly a user-defined type derived from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationContent>).
For Atom 1.0, the Content property is serialized to a `<content>` element.
For RSS 2.0, the Content property is serialized to a `<description>` element for <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.TextSyndicationContent>, a `<a10:content>` element for <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.UrlSyndicationContent> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.XmlSyndicationContent>.
## Examples The following code shows how to add content to a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem>.
[!code-cs[SyndicationItem#24](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.sy_9_1.cs)] [!code-vb[SyndicationItem#24](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.sy_9_1.vb)]
The following XML shows how the Content property is serialized for Atom 1.0.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.TextSyndicationContent> is serialized as shown in the following example.
``` <content type="text">This is some content</content> ```
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.UrlSyndicationContent> is serialized as shown in the following example.
``` <content type="text/html" src="http://myurl/" /> ```
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.XmlSyndicationContent> is serialized as shown in the following example.
``` <content type="MyXMLType"> <mg:MyElement xmlns:mg="http://migree/elements">This is some text</mg:MyElement> </content> ```
The following XML shows how the Content property is serialized for RSS 2.0.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.TextSyndicationContent> is serialized as shown in the following example.
``` <description>This is some content</description> ```
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.UrlSyndicationContent> is serialized as shown in the following example.
``` <a10:content type="text/html" src="http://myurl/" /> ```
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.XmlSyndicationContent> is serialized as shown in the following example.
``` <a10:content type="MyXMLType"> <mg:MyElement xmlns:mg="http://migree/elements">This is some text</mg:MyElement> </a10:content> ```

Docs.summary: Gets the contributors of the syndication item.
Docs.value: A collection of objects that represent the contributors of the syndication item.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When serialized to Atom 1.0, a `<contributor>` element is created for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the Contributors collection.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, a `<a10:contributor>` element is created for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the Contributors collection.
## Examples The following code shows how to add a contributor to a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem>.
[!code-cs[SyndicationItem#25](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.sy_1_1.cs)] [!code-vb[SyndicationItem#25](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.sy_1_1.vb)]

[!code-xml[SyndicationItem#10](~/add/codesnippet/xml/p-system.servicemodel.sy_1_2.xml)]
The following XML shows how this property is serialized to RSS 2.0.
[!code-xml[SyndicationItem#11](~/add/codesnippet/xml/p-system.servicemodel.sy_1_3.xml)]

Docs.summary: Gets and sets the copyright information for the syndication item.
Docs.value: A instance that represents copyright information.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When serialized to Atom 1.0, this property is written to a `<rights>` element. When serialized to RSS 2.0, this property is written to a `<a10:rights>` element.
## Examples The following code shows how to add copyright information to a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem>.
[!code-cs[SyndicationItem#26](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.sy_23_1.cs)] [!code-vb[SyndicationItem#26](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.sy_23_1.vb)]
The following XML shows how this property is serialized to Atom 1.0.
``` <rights type="text">Copyright 2007</rights> ```
The following XML shows how this property is serialized to RSS 2.0.
``` <a10:rights type="text">Copyright 2007</a10:rights> ```

Docs.summary: Creates a new category.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This does not add the new <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory> object to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Categories%2A> collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The new <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink> instance is not automatically added to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance used to call the CreateLink method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson CreatePerson() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new person.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This does not add the new <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> object to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Authors%2A> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem.Contributors%2A> collection.

Docs.summary: Gets the element extensions contained in the syndication item.
Docs.value: A that contains the element extensions.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. Any valid XML element can be added as an extension provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace. When serialized, extensions are written like any other XML element.
``` <mg:MyElement xmlns:mg="http://myserver/elements" /> ```
For a complete example that shows how to add element extensions, see the [Loosely-Typed Extensions](../Topic/Loosely-Typed%20Extensions%20Sample.md) sample.
## Examples The following code shows how to add element extensions to a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance.
[!code-cs[LooselyTypedExtensions#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.sy_36_1.cs)] [!code-vb[LooselyTypedExtensions#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.sy_36_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets an instance.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code shows how to write a syndication item in RSS 2.0 format to an XML file.
[!code-cs[SyndicationItem#43](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.servicemodel.sy_5_1.cs)] [!code-vb[SyndicationItem#43](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.servicemodel.sy_5_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Rss20ItemFormatter GetRss20Formatter(bool serializeExtensionsAsAtom) cil managed

Docs.param: A value that specifies whether to serialize element and attribute extensions with an Atom 1.0 namespace.
Docs.summary: Gets an instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks RSS 2.0 allows elements and attributes that are not in its specification only if they are within a namespace. When the `serializedExtensionsAsAtom` parameter is `true`, the formatter automatically adds the "a10" namespace to all extensions; otherwise, the extensions are not serialized.
## Examples The following code shows how to write a syndication item in RSS 2.0 format to an XML file, serializing attribute and element extensions.
[!code-cs[SyndicationItem#44](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/dc0ce6ce-b0c5-40ab-adec-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[SyndicationItem#44](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/dc0ce6ce-b0c5-40ab-adec-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets and sets the ID of the syndication item.
Docs.value: The ID of the syndication item.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When serialized to Atom 1.0, this property is written to the `<id>` element. When serialized to RSS 2.0, this property is written to the `<guid>` element.
## Examples The following code shows how to set the Id property on a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance.
[!code-cs[SyndicationItem#27](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.sy_19_1.cs)] [!code-vb[SyndicationItem#27](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.sy_19_1.vb)]
The following XML shows how this property is serialized to Atom 1.0.
``` <id>Item ID</id> ```
The following XML shows how this property is serialized to RSS 2.0.
``` <guid isPermaLink="false">Item ID</guid> ```

Docs.summary: Gets and sets the last updated time for the syndication item.
Docs.value: A instance that represents the time the syndication item was last updated.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When serialized to Atom 1.0, this property is written to an `<updated>` item. When serialized to RSS 2.0, this property is written to an `<a10:updated>` item.
## Examples The following code shows how to set the LastUpdatedTime property on a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance.
[!code-cs[SyndicationItem#28](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.sy_29_1.cs)] [!code-vb[SyndicationItem#28](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.sy_29_1.vb)]
The following XML shows how this property is serialized to Atom 1.0.
``` <updated>2007-03-19T20:34:23Z</updated> ```
The following XML shows how this property is serialized to RSS 2.0.
``` <a10:updated>2007-03-19T20:34:23Z</a10:updated> ```

Docs.summary: Gets the links contained in the syndication item.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When serialized to Atom 1.0, a `<link>` element is written for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink> in the collection. When serialized to RSS 2.0, an `<a10:link>` element is written for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink> in the collection.
## Examples The following code shows how to add a link to the Links collection of a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance.
[!code-cs[SyndicationItem#29](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.sy_27_1.cs)] [!code-vb[SyndicationItem#29](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.sy_27_1.vb)]

The following XML shows how this property is serialized to RSS 2.0.
[!code-xml[SyndicationItem#13](~/add/codesnippet/xml/p-system.servicemodel.sy_27_3.xml)]

MemberSignature.Value: public static TSyndicationItem Load<TSyndicationItem> (System.Xml.XmlReader reader) where TSyndicationItem : System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItemnew();
.method public static hidebysig !!TSyndicationItem Load<.ctor (class System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem) TSyndicationItem>(class System.Xml.XmlReader reader) cil managed

Docs.param: The to read from.
Docs.summary: Loads a derived object from the specified .
Docs.returns: A derived object that contains the syndication item.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method when you are loading a syndication item into a class derived from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem>.
## Examples The following code shows how to load a syndication item of the specified type from an XML reader.
[!code-cs[SyndicationItem#37](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.servicemodel.sy_3_1.cs)] [!code-vb[SyndicationItem#37](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.servicemodel.sy_3_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets and sets the publish date for the syndication item.
Docs.value: A object that represents the publish date for the syndication item.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When serialized to Atom 1.0, this property is written to a `<published>` element. When serialized to RSS 2.0, this property is written to a `<pubDate>` element.
## Examples The following code shows how to set the PublishDate on a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instance.
[!code-cs[SyndicationItem#30](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.sy_39_1.cs)] [!code-vb[SyndicationItem#30](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.sy_39_1.vb)]
The following XML shows how this property is serialized to Atom 1.0.
``` <published>1968-02-23T08:00:00Z</published> ```
The following XML shows how this property is serialized to RSS 2.0.
``` <pubDate>Fri, 23 Feb 1968 08:00:00 Z</pubDate> ```

Docs.summary: Gets and sets the source feed of the syndication item.
Docs.value: A instance where the syndication item is located.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is not automatically set when you add a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> to a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed>—you must explicitly set it. When serialized to Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0, this property is written to a `<source>` element. The contents of that element vary depending on the format you serialize to.
## Examples The following XML shows how the SourceFeed property is serialized to Atom 1.0.
[!code-xml[SyndicationItem#14](~/add/codesnippet/xml/p-system.servicemodel.sy_14_1.xml)]
The following XML shows how the SourceFeed property is serialized to RSS 2.0.
[!code-xml[SyndicationItem#15](~/add/codesnippet/xml/p-system.servicemodel.sy_14_2.xml)]

Docs.value: A that contains a summary of the item.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual bool TryParseAttribute (string name, string ns, string value, string version);
.method familyorassemblyhidebysig newslot virtual instance bool TryParseAttribute(string name, string ns, string value, string version) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the element.
The namespace of the element.
The attribute to parse.
The syndication version to use when parsing.
Docs.summary: Attempts to parse an attribute extension.
Docs.returns: A value that specifies whether the attribute extension was parsed successfully.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Attribute extensions are custom attributes that are not defined by the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. They are serialized as an attribute of the `<entry>` (for Atom 1.0) or `<item>` (for RSS 1.0) element, depending upon the syndication version being used. This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the deserialization of a custom attribute extension. To do this, you must derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized attribute extensions.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual bool TryParseContent (System.Xml.XmlReader reader, string contentType, string version, out System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationContent content);

.method familyorassemblyhidebysig newslot virtual instance bool TryParseContent(class System.Xml.XmlReader reader, string contentType, string version, class System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationContent content) cil managed

Docs.param: The to read from.
The content type of the content.
The syndication version to use while parsing.
The instance to load the parsed content into.
Docs.summary: Attempts to parse content.
Docs.returns: A value that specifies whether the content was parsed successfully.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the deserialization of a custom content. To do this, you must derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized content.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual bool TryParseElement (System.Xml.XmlReader reader, string version);
.method familyorassemblyhidebysig newslot virtual instance bool TryParseElement(class System.Xml.XmlReader reader, string version) cil managed

Docs.param: The to read from.
The syndication version to use while parsing.
Docs.summary: Attempts to parse an element extension.
Docs.returns: A value that specifies whether the element extension was parsed successfully.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. You can add any valid XML element as an extension, provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace. This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the deserialization of a custom element extension. To do this, you must derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized element extensions.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void WriteAttributeExtensions (System.Xml.XmlWriter writer, string version);
.method familyorassemblyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void WriteAttributeExtensions(class System.Xml.XmlWriter writer, string version) cil managed

Docs.param: The to write to.
The syndication version to use while writing.
Docs.summary: Writes the attribute extensions to the specified using the specified syndication version.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Attribute extensions are custom attributes that are not defined by the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. They are serialized as an attribute of the `<entry>` (for Atom 1.0) or `<item>` (for RSS 1.0) element, depending upon the syndication version being used. This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the serialization of custom attribute extensions. To do this, you must derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized attribute extensions.

Docs.param: The to write to.
The syndication version to use while writing.
Docs.summary: Writes the element extensions to the specified using the specific syndication version.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. You can add any valid XML element as an extension, provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace. This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the serialization of custom element extensions. To do this, you must derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized element extensions.
